intro: Marrubium micranthum, commonly known as small-flowered horehound, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It typically grows in dry, rocky, or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. The plant features a basal rosette of gray-green, hairy leaves and produces small, blue or purple flowers in terminal clusters. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy, often blue or violet flowers. Marrubium micranthum is valued for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
